page.title: 11Trade in Springfield
page.content: There are five{shops}in Springfield selling groceries, vegetables, butchermeat, drapery and newspapers. There is a garage which no longer sells petrol but sells calor gas and hires out taxies. The village population, 750, is well served by mobile vans selling groceries, baking, butchermeat, fish, fish and chips, ice cream, milk, clothing, shoes, lemonade, coal, logs and peat. Videos can be hired from a van. Books can be borrowed from the library van. An important{shopping facility}for a country district is a mail order catalogue. Goods can be ordered by post. Springfield people go into the main shopping centre in Cupar, which is 3 miles away.The nearest petrol station is also there.
